subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Which of the following molecules has an electron pair geometry
that matches its molecular geometry:
W) H O
2
X) NH
3
Y) SO
2
Z) PCl
5

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Which of the following is NOT a constitutional isomer of the
organic compound whose molecular formula is C H :
4 8
W) 1-butene
X) 2-butene
Y) 2-methyl-1-butene
Z) 2-methyl-1-propene
answer:
Y) 2-METHYL-1-BUTENE
(Solution: 2-methyl-1-butene has a molecular formula of C H )
5 10

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Within the Standard Model of Particle Physics what particle is
responsible for carrying the strong nuclear force?

subject: PHYSICS
content:
What is the principle or law that fundamentally limits the accuracy of
specifying at the same time the momentum and position of a particle?

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
Which of the following occurs during synapsis of meiosis:
W) non-sister chromatids of homologous chromosomes cross over
X) sister chromatids of homologous chromosomes cross over
Y) non-sister chromatids of non-homologous chromosomes cross over
Z) sister chromatids of non-homologous chromosomes cross over
answer:
W) NON-SISTER CHROMATIDS OF HOMOLOGOUS CHROMOSOMES CROSS
OVER

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
If 2n is the number of chromosomes and 2s is the DNA content of a
diploid human cell in G1 of the cell cycle, what are the n and s values, respectively, of a human
spermatogonia at the end of telophase one of meiosis?

subject: MATH
content: In simplest radical form, give the cosecant of a 135º angle:

subject: MATH
content:
Find the value of k that will result in a unique, real solution for the
following equation: kx2 + 10x + 25 = 0

subject: EARTH SCIENCE
content:
Groundwater flows according to what law that, in its
simplest form, is given by the equation Q = kIA:
W) Darcy’s Law
X) Law of Superposition
Y) Law of Original Horizontality
Z) Ekman’s Law

subject: EARTH SCIENCE
content:
Which of the following is a type of inland fog that occurs
more often in spring when warm, moist air is cooled below its dew point as it moves over a cooler
surface:
W) advection fog
X) radiation fog
Y) reflection fog
Z) steam fog

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
A primary consequence of acid rain in the northeast
U.S. has been:
W) salt-water intrusion in coastal wells
X) the leaching out of toxic heavy metals in lakes and streams
Y) increase in radioactive decay of parent bedrock
Z) increased algal growth to cause eutrophication in lakes
answer:
X) THE LEACHING OUT OF TOXIC HEAVY METALS IN LAKES AND
STREAMS

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
About two-thirds of the cause of acid precipitation is the
production of sulfuric acid in the atmosphere. The production of what acid accounts for about the
other one-third of acid rain?

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
If an astronomer photographed a massive cloud of ionized
hydrogen in space that was emitting all of the Balmer wavelengths, what color would it typically
appear to us:
W) white
X) green
Y) pink
Z) blue

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
Which of the following was discovered in the 1600’s about
Venus that was strong evidence that the planets orbited the Sun:
W) Venus’s cloud cover reverses its direction in the sky at certain times of the year
X) Venus has phases varying from crescent to full
Y) Venus has an axial motion opposite to that of the Earth
Z) Venus is the brightest planet in the sky only part of the year
answer: X) VENUS HAS PHASES VARYING FROM CRESCENT TO FULL

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
For a given chemical reaction at constant temperature and
pressure, if the value for Gibbs free-energy change is a negative, the reaction is always:
W) endothermic
X) exothermic
Y) spontaneous
Z) nonspontaneous

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
In a phase diagram, the solid-liquid line has a negative slope for
which of the following pure substances:
W) carbon dioxide
X) water
Y) ammonia
Z) argon
answer:
X) WATER
(Solution: solid water is less dense than liquid water)

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Which of the following was the big surprise in the classic gold foil
experiments of Rutherford, Geiger and Marsden:
W) alpha particles sometimes disappeared
X) electrons would not penetrate the nucleus
Y) the atom was mostly space as supported by the finding that most alpha particles continued on a
straight path and hit the rear of the detection screen
Z) some alpha particles left evidence of having returned almost straight back to hit the front part of
the detection screen
answer:
Z) SOME ALPHA PARTICLES LEFT EVIDENCE OF HAVING RETURNED
ALMOST STRAIGHT BACK TO HIT THE FRONT PART OF THE DETECTION SCREEN

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Most of the early classical experiments with alpha particles were done
by Rutherford and co-workers using a simple scintillation detector, which was a screen most
commonly coated with what substance?

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
Which of the following is NOT true of chloroplasts:
W) they are relatively large organelles and can exceed 3 microns long
X) thay have smaller ribosomes than are found in the plant cytosol
Y) they contain thylakoid (read as: THY-la-koid) stacks
Z) their numbers are controlled primarily by the cell’s nuclear genes that control division
answer:
Z) THEIR NUMBERS ARE CONTROLLED PRIMARILY BY THE CELL’S
NUCLEAR GENES THAT CONTROL DIVISION

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
By number or name, identify all of the following 4 areas of plants
where you would be MOST likely to see meristematic tissue:
1) longitudinal section of a terminal bud
2) cross-section of the pith of a sunflower stem
3) transverse section of a lateral root tip
4) cross-section of central parenchymal cells of a corn stem
answer:
1 AND 3 (ACCEPT: 1 - LONGITUDINAL SECTION OF A TERMINAL BUD AND
3 - TRANSVERSE SECTION OF A LATERAL ROOT TIP)

subject: MATH
content:
Giving your answer as one, two, three, or four, in what quadrant will
theta terminate if sine θ and secant θ are both negative?

subject: MATH
content:
Differentiate and simplify the following with respect to x: y = ln x
(read as: y = natural log of absolute value of x)
1

subject: EARTH SCIENCE
content:
Which of the following is the global wind system that
most influences weather in the West Indies and Central America:
W) northeast trade winds
X) prevailing westerlies
Y) southeast trade winds
Z) polar westerlies

subject: EARTH SCIENCE
content:
Which of the following is the soil horizon that contains a
mixture of organic matter and highly altered mineral matter and is dark in color:
W) O-horizon
X) A-horizon
Y) C-horizon
Z) R-horizon

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
Which of the following statements is LEAST accurate:
W) the molecular formula for dimethyl sulfoxide is C H SO
2 6
X) black smokers are a type of hydrothermal vent found on the ocean floor
Y) Io is the most volcanically active body in our Solar System
Z) on a weather map, an adjacent series of closed half-circles along a line represents a cold front
answer:
Z) ON A WEATHER MAP, AN ADJACENT SERIES OF CLOSED HALF-CIRCLES
ALONG A LINE REPRESENTS A COLD FRONT

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
Which of the following is NOT generally true
regarding the hydrologic cycle world-wide:
W) glaciers are shrinking
X) river discharge is decreasing
Y) precipitation at high altitudes is increasing
Z) the thickness of sea ice over the Arctic Ocean is decreasing

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
following stars has the highest absolute visual magnitude and is also the hottest:
W) one located in the upper left of the diagram
X) one located in the upper right of the diagram
Y) one located in the lower left of the diagram
Z) one located in the lower right of the diagram
answer: W) ONE LOCATED IN THE UPPER LEFT OF THE DIAGRAM

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
What is the MOST common scientific term for the specific
spectral line-splitting effect resulting when atoms absorb or emit radiation in the presence of a
magnetic field?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
In order to find the heat of reaction, or delta H naught, for a
reaction using standard enthalpies of formation, the working formula is:
W) delta H products minus delta H reactants
X) delta H reactants minus delta H products
Y) delta H reactants plus delta H products
Z) delta H products plus delta H reactants
answer: W) DELTA H PRODUCTS MINUS DELTA H REACTANTS

subject: CHEMISTRY
content: nearest neighbors, of an atom in the simple cubic unit cell structure?

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Which of the following is NOT true:
W) the hydrogen nucleus has a lower binding energy per nucleon than the helium nucleus
X) the tritium nucleus contains 3 nucleons
Y) it is typically easier to fission U-238 than U-235 with slow neutrons
Z) fission fragments of a nucleus are more often about 60% and 40% of the original mass of the
atom than 50% and 50%
answer:
Y) IT IS TYPICALLY EASIER TO FISSION U-238 THAN U-235 WITH SLOW
NEUTRONS

subject: PHYSICS
content:
In the Standard Model of particle physics, all forces arise because of
the exchange of what fundamental class of particles?

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
If the human SRY gene is inactivated in the first week of
gestation, which of the following will occur:
W) the embryo will die
X) the embryo will remain female
Y) the embryo will continue as a male
Z) the embryo will remain in a quiescent state
answer: X) THE EMBRYO WILL REMAIN FEMALE

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
Which of the following functions primarily by cutting RNA
strands at specific sites:
W) micro RNA
X) episome
Y) ribozyme
Z) ligase

subject: MATH
content:
Simplify the following trigonometric expression completely: cos θ tan θ
(read as: cosine theta tangent theta)

subject: MATH
content:
In how many ways can 4 green, 2 yellow, and 2 red tee-shirts be given to
8 soccer players standing in a row if each player receives only one tee-shirt?

subject: EARTH SCIENCE
content:
Which of the following is a glacial feature that is NOT
caused by the deposition of sediments:
W) kame
X) kettle
Y) drumlin
Z) bergshrund

subject: EARTH SCIENCE
content:
Analysis of which of the following isotopes is most
commonly used because it gives the BEST indication of historical temperatures at different latitudes
worldwide:
W) oxygen
X) carbon
Y) nitrogen
Z) potassium

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
What is the SI unit for absorbed dose of ionizing
radiation?

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
Nisin is an antibiotic currently being studied because it
has not yet induced widespread biological resistance. Which of the following is its mode of action:
W) directly inhibits the electron transport system in bacteria
X) inhibits in vivo endotoxin formation
Y) binds to a bacterial cell wall precursor to form damaging pores in the plasma membrane
Z) binds to 30-S ribosomal subunit
answer:
Y) BINDS TO A BACTERIAL CELL WALL PRECURSOR TO FORM DAMAGING
PORES IN THE PLASMA MEMBRANE

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
What is the most common astronomical term for the geometrical
configuration where Venus is between the Earth and the Sun?

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
How many degrees of arc are in 4 hours and 20 minutes of right
ascension?

subject: PHYSICS
content:
What is the focal length, in centimeters and giving the proper sign, of
a convex mirror that has a radius of curvature of 12 centimeters?

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Rutherford and coworkers in the early 20th century found that when
alpha particles strike nitrogen-14 nuclei, they most commonly produce what element?
answer:
OXYGEN (ACCEPT: OXYGEN-17 or O-17)
(Solution: He-4 + N-14 à O-17 + proton)

content:

content:
Consider a flexible balloon filled with 3.0 moles of helium at a
temperature of 27ºC and at a pressure of 101.3 kilopascals. What is the volume in the balloon, in
liters to the nearest whole number?

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
In which of the following 4 phases of cell cycle would a chemical
that causes mispairing of bases during replication do the most damage: G-1; G-2; S; M

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
For a dihybrid cross between parent plants that are each
heterozygous for both traits, if there is complete dominance and independent assortment, what is the
total fraction of the offspring that will have a recessive phenotype for either trait and the dominant
for the other?

subject: PHYSICS
content:
What is the angular velocity, in radians per second, of a wagon wheel
with a diameter of 2 meters and a surface velocity of 3 meters per second?

subject: PHYSICS
content:
The dread pirate Roberts orders his crew into a 100 kilogram rowboat
to sail to an island to look for buried treasure. If the rowboat has a capacity of 1.10 cubic meters and
is in freshwater, how many 50 kilogram pirates can board the rowboat before it would sink?
